intro: Pycnosphaera trimera, commonly known as the coral tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, branching stems that resemble coral, hence its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Pycnosphaera trimera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
